alert.note: Alert for Johnston (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 09 at 2:01PM EDT until July 09 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Harnett and Johnston. * WHEN...Until 500 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of urban areas, rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 200 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Smithfield, Lillington, Clayton, Dunn, Benson, Micro, Selma, Erwin, Coats, Four Oaks, Pine Level, Kenly, Coats Crossroads, Buies Creek, Raven Rock State Park, Flowers, Anderson Creek, Timberlake, Emit and Pineview.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
